definition[0]: (the United Nations) an international organization that almost every country in the world belongs to. It was started in 1945 to to try to find peaceful solutions to international problems and to make sure that countries work together to find peace. Its headquarters (=main offices) are in New York City. Other organizations that belong to the UN, such as the World Bank and the World Health Organization, are based in other places. Decisions at the UN are made by the General Assembly and the Security Council.
definition[1]: used to show a negative, a lack, or an opposite
definition[2]: used to show an opposite of a particular action
example[4]: to undress  (=to take your clothes off)
example[5]: Have you unpacked yet  (=taken your things out of your suitcase)?
example[6]: I heard Lila unlock the front door.
